text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
Hello Kitty cupcake tutorial I'll be
showing you how to make this gorgeous
Hello Kitty cupcake I've had so many
requests for Hello Kitty in a cupcake
and this is my take on this iconic
little kitty cat tools and equipment
that we will be using today I have some
white fondant and I'll have just a very
small amount of a red fondant I've got
pre colored fondant for my red you can
also use pink Hello Kitty can either
have a red or pink I've got a cupcake
which I've actually baked in a white
case today so that it will match in with
my white kitty I've got a little bit of
water just a paintbrush a cocktail stick
or toothpick I've got some mini M&Ms
I've picked out the brown and the yellow
ones I've got just some supermarket
black liquid food coloring I've got a
circle cutter since R and a quarter inch
or an 8 centimeter for me I've just
chosen one that's roughly about a size
bigger than the top of my cupcake I've
got a fondant roller or just a regular
rolling pin if you don't have a fondant
roller I've got a knife I've got a
little bit of our perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting which we do have a
great tutorial and recipe for on our
channel if you want to check that out
and I've got just a little shaker with
some cornflour in it you can also use
icing sugar and that's just to stop my
fondant from sticking
first up so we're going to just do a
nice little frosting dome so I'm just
going to take my knife dip it into that
frosting and I'm just going to spread
that frost into a bit of a mound on top
of my cupcake now I'm just going to
smooth that out to the edges try not to
go over the edges and then I'm just
going to using the back of my knife
because it's nice and flat I'm just
going to smooth that round into a nice
little dome shape if you're making a
whole lot of these don't do too many of
these in it advance because the
buttercream tends to crust a little bit
so you really want to frost and then
fondant and then frost and then fondant
otherwise you'll find your phone has
nothing to stick to so I'm going to take
a little bit of this white fondant I
like to keep mine in a ziploc bag it
just stops it from drying out just going
to need it in between my hands
just for a couple of seconds to soften
it up make it nice and easy to roll roll
it into a bowl because I'm going for a
bit of a circle shape a little bit of
this cornflour pop down the fondant give
it a little bit of a swipe around in
that cornflour and I'm just going to
roll it out into a bit of a circle shape
so that we can cut our nice Hello Kitty
face circle doesn't really matter how
thick or thin you want to roll this just
depends on how much you like the taste
of fondant you can also use modeling
chocolate modeling chocolates are not
going to be quite as bright white as the
fondant is so keep that in mind let's
check that lovely circle cutter just cut
out a nice circle and then I'm going to
slide that circle smack back on top of
that frosting now I'm going to use just
I guess the flats of my fingers just to
smooth it down to the edges so you can
see that I'm kind of holding it in
position with my middle finger and with
my index finger I'm just pushing it down
to the edges you can see by going that
size cookie cutter bigger than the top
of the cupcake once you put the frosting
on it really gives you almost a perfect
fit so once you're happy that you've got
your fondant secure just give it a
little rock around in the palm of your
hand just to smooth it out you should
have a lovely smooth fondant dome now
we're going to add Kitty's ears so take
some of that leftover fondant you just
want to rip off sort of two
similar-sized about a P shaped ball a
little bit more there so I like to do
both of mine together so that I can see
what I'm working with make sure that
they're about the same size I'm going to
roll that into a ball and then I'm just
going to use my finger to take it out
into a bit of a cone shape
do that again with the other one into a
ball and then out into a bit of a corner
a tear drop I guess take a little bit of
that water just a little bit you really
don't want too much less is more with
the water I'm just going to add a bit of
a dot there and a bit of a dot there for
Hello Kitty's ears and push those ears
down and that water's going to be the
glue that sticks it on just flatten the
ear off nicely and again with the other
side
as Kitty's is now it's time for us to do
our whiskers so for the whiskers I'm
just going to dip the cocktail stick
into that liquid food coloring you can
also use an edible marker for this if
you like you can cut little pieces of
licorice but this was just the easiest
option now I'm just going to take the
cocktail stick and I'm just going to
slide it down read it the nice steady
hand sometimes it does help to balance
your hand as you're doing this on the
match or the surface that you're working
on and will give Kitty his whiskers her
whiskers I should say now let's take
that red fondant and we'll make Kitty's
bow so I'm just going to take I guess
about the same size that you used for
both of those ears rip off just a little
bit and roll that into a ball now I'm
going to turn it just with the middle of
my finger into a bit of a guess like a
peanut shape so you've got two bulgy
ends and then that peanut in the middle
at the back of my paintbrush I'm just
going to hollow out the middle that's
going to give us the basis for the bone
this is going to be our bow Center so
roll it into a bowl into a little
sausage shape a little bit of water in
the middle there and slide that on so
there you have Kitty's bar and we're
just going to take a little bit of that
water and pop it just under the ear pop
on the bone to finish our Hello Kitty
cupcake off we're going to put one two
and
the red little dabs of water and making
sure to put the em down so Kitty doesn't
have em in her eyes just press those
M&Ms on that little dot of water you
could also use melted chocolate just a
little tiny bit of melted chocolate if
you wanted but the water generally does
a pretty good job so there you have your
gorgeous Hello Kitty cupcakes really
quite easy very effective and sure to be
a crowd pleaser thanks very much for
watching
